message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.MM

This paper deals with the problem of multi-view face synthesis, which involves generating multiple views of a face from a single input image. This is a problem that is commonly studied in the computer vision (CV) community. The proposed method uses generative adversarial networks (GANs), which is a popular technique in machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) research. Therefore, the most likely sub-category for this paper is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). 

The paper also proposes a novel approach for decomposing the synthesis problem into two subtasks, which involves training the normalizer and editor networks in a two-stage manner. This approach involves balancing the load between the two networks, which is a topic that is relevant to the field of machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL). Therefore, the paper could also be classified under cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

The paper also uses attention-based techniques to improve the quality of the generated images, which is a topic that is relevant to the field of graphics (GR) and multimedia (MM). Therefore, the paper could also be classified under cs.GR (Computer Graphics) and cs.MM (Multimedia).
